title: ‘Failed mosque terrorist’ overpowered by pensioner makes Nazi salute in court
text:
Philip Manshaus has so far made two Nazi salutes and appeared with black eyes and injuries in court (Picture: AFP)

A Norwegian man accused of an attempted terror attack at a mosque has given another Nazi salute in court this morning.

The alleged gunman, Philip Manshaus, 21, was attending a hearing at a courthouse in Oslo, charged with murder and breaching anti-terrorism laws.

Appearing in court in August with two black eyes and injuries to his face, smirked at photographers as he was accused of killing his step-sister, 17, before embarking on a ‘failed’ terror attack.

Manshaus allegedly entered the Al-Noor Islamic Centre in Baerum, near Oslo, and began ‘waving weapons’ on Saturday, August 10. One person sustained minor injuries, but worshippers say 65-year-old Mohammad Rafiq overpowered the suspect and held him down until police arrived.

Prime Minister Erna Solberg later labelled the incident a ‘direct attack on Norwegian Muslims’.

The suspect with his legal team Unni Fries (L) and Audun Becksrom while appearing in an Oslo court today (Picture: EPA)

The 21-year-old had a number of injuries when he appeared in court on 10 August (Picture: EPA)

Manshaus’ lawyer Unni Fries has previously declined to comment on Norwegian media reports that the suspect was inspired by this year’s shootings in Christchurch, New Zealand, and in El Paso, Texas.

Man 'raped pregnant girlfriend to try and kill their unborn baby'

Police say they found the body of Manhaus’ step sister, Johanne Zhangia Ihle-Hansen, following a raid on his house.

Manshaus is reportedly yet to be formally charged but remains in custody. On September 9, at another court hearing, Manshaus made a Nazi salute to the media.

In July 2011, far-right terrorist Anders Behring Breivik massacred 92 people in Norway’s worst terror attack.

Flowers and a police cordon in front of the Al-Noor Islamic Centre Mosque (Picture: AFP)

description: Philip Manshaus is accused of killing his step sister before entering Al-Noor Islamic Center near Oslo and being tackled by a 65-year-old.
